Different types of Sentences

In English grammar, there are four main types of sentences:
1. Declarative Sentences
2. Interrogative Sentences
3. Imperative Sentences
4. Exclamatory Sentences



1. Declarative Sentences

Declarative sentences make statements or provide information. They end with a full stop/ period.

I enjoy playing the guitar.
Qutub Minar is situated in Delhi.





2. Interrogative Sentences

Interrogative sentences are used to ask questions. They end with a question mark.

Have you finished your homework?
What time is the meeting?





3. Imperative Sentences

Imperative sentences give commands, instructions, or make requests. They usually don't have a subject explicitly stated (you is implied). They can end with a period or an exclamation mark, depending on the tone.

Have you finished your homework?
What time is the meeting?



4. Exclamatory Sentences

Exclamatory sentences express strong emotions or surprise. They end with an exclamation mark.

What a beautiful sunset!
Bravo! we won the match.
